article.title: Daily status reporting
article.label: Daily Reports
article.intro: Read how our project managers report to you on project progress
article.description: Daily reports keeps you on track during project execution.
article.keywords: daily report, project reporting, project communications plan, project tracking

text.p: The Project manager reports to you on a daily basis by the conclusion of each business day. No matter what was done during a day by the project team, and what results were obtained, a Daily Report is sent by email to you.

ul.li: Project status (on track, behind schedule, etc.)

text.p: This is an example of Daily Report:
text.pre:
John,
According to the Iteration Plan we committed, today we've done the following (an aggregation of reports I've received from team members and re-worked):
- SRS refined (R15-R22) - SAD improved (DE1, DE5, DE8) - Implemented: R10, R12 - Tested and Deployed: R3
The project is "on track" according to SPI (0.95).
Top risks still active:
- API may be delivered not in time - .Net architect may be unavailable next week - Lack of your feedback on Friday may delay project release milestone
The closest Milestone is on 12-Jan (end of the day).
Liza Peterson, PM
text.p: Since we do incremental delivery of Deliverables, each Daily Report may include new functionality implemented and tested. Your feedback on each Daily Report is expected and welcomed.

concepts.c1: Project team is available during normal business days and hours
concepts.c2: We deliver value to you in incremental and iterative manner
concepts.c3: Iteration is the atomic element of project Schedule
